intro: Sagraea hirtella, commonly known as the hairy sagraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
